quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Word and Line
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following characters can be described as oleaginous?

options.text: Dorian Gray (The Picture of Dorian Gray by Wilde)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uriah Heep (David Copperfield by Dickens)

questions.question: What movie starring Johnny Depp, Kiera Knightley and Orlando Bloom ends with the line, Drink up, me earties, yo-ho!?

options.text: Pirates of the Caribbean: At Worlds End
Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Mans Chest
Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl

questions.question: What character is portrayed by actor Brad Pitt in the 1994 movie, Interview with the Vampire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis de Pointe du Lac

questions.question: What does the word casuistry mean?

options.text: The hypothesis that the Earth moves around the Moon
Psychological analysis of a persons intentions and motivation
Moral principles concerning sexual relations with women
Moral philosophy based on the application of general ethical principles

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moral philosophy based on the application of general ethical principles

questions.question: Actor Brad Pitt portrays the character of J.D. in what 1991 road movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thelma and Louise

questions.question: The word inanition means this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mental hollowness

questions.question: If you are a deipnosophist then you are good at this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Across-the-table chit chat

questions.question: What film directed by Ang Lee ends with Heath Ledger whispering, Jack, I swear.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brokeback Mountain

questions.question: If your behaviour is agrestic, it is this.

options.text: In harmony with the given situation

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rustic and uncouth

questions.question: A Syzygy is the straight line configuration of 3 ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Celestial bodies

questions.question: Pleonasm is a literary term. Which of these could be considered an example of pleonasm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A tiny little child

questions.question: This Oscar-winning Bill Murray film ends with a line whispered so softly, that very few can hear it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lost in Translation

questions.question: If leaves are glabrous, then they have none of these qualities, except one. Can you spot it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Softness

questions.question: The word condign means undeserved and unmerited.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What does the word elysian mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Happy, blissful, relating to paradise

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Brad Pitt and Movie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Identify the incorrect pairing in the following list.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virgin - Virginess

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anthony Hopkins

questions.question: Brad Pitt and Jennifer Aniston starred together in the 2003 movie, Bruce Almighty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the correct term for a woman skilled in the art of massage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Masseuse

questions.question: Brad Pitt had a small role in the 1993 movie, True Romance.  Who was the lead male actor in the movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christian Slater

questions.question: What is the female of the horse family called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mare

questions.question: In British peerage, which of the following is the correct pairing of male and female?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Actor Brat Pitt appeared in all, but one of these movies.  Which one did he not appear in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Speed

questions.question: What is the male equivalent of the word witch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Warlock

questions.question: Who starred in the 1995 movie Se7en opposite Brad Pitt, portraying the character of Detective Lt. William Somerset?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morgan Freeman

questions.question: In the animal world, what is a male cat called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What famous male actor appears opposite Brad Pitt in the 1997 movie, The Devils Own?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harrison Ford

questions.question: In the bovine family, what is the male counterpart of the cow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bull

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Greece and Battle
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, world, part. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the term for a female cat who has given birth - or is about to give birth - to her kittens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A queen

questions.question: A doe is a deer, a female deer. What is the male of the family called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of this pairing of animals is incorrect?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goat - Nanny

questions.question: Which Japanese Vice Admiral commanded the Japanese military planes during the attack on Pearl Harbor on December 7th, 1941?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuichi Nagumo

questions.question: Who headed the Anglo-American invasion, known as Operation Torch, which began on November 8th, 1942?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General Dwight Eisenhower

questions.question: What are the accurate names for young male and female horses?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colt and Filly

questions.question: Which of these pairs is grammatically and politically correct?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abbot - Abbess

questions.question: What is the male equivalent of a mermaid?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Merman

questions.question: During WW II, Italy invaded Greece on October 28th, 1940. The Italians attacked Greece through which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albania

questions.question: Which Soviet espionage organisation warned the Soviet Front commanders about the German offensive, planned to begin between July 3rd and July 6th, 1943?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Red Orchestra

questions.question: In 1941, the Second Sino-Japanese war became part of the Second World War. What was the name of the British Major-General who defended Hong Kong when the Japanese attacked the colony in December, 1941?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher M. Malby

questions.question: This battle which took place in May, 1942 was a prelude to the Battle of Midway.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Coral Sea

questions.question: In which battle between Germans and Russians, the Germans had the largest number of military machinery during WWII?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Kursk

questions.question: A male sheep is a ram. What is the female sheep called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ewe

questions.question: What is the male counterpart of a nun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monk

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Attack and Battle
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, ground, nicknames. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Little Boy and Fat Man were the nicknames given to the atomic bombs dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Most people are familiar with the Japanese suicide pilots Kamikaze that harassed allied ships toward the end of the war.  However, the Japanese had another form of suicide attack that was less well known.  Which of the following were they called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kaiten

questions.question: A customer closed out his million-dollar account after his bank refused to validate a 60 parking ticket.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Someone once wrote a check on the side of a cow.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Had the atomic bombs not been dropped and the Japanese not surrendered, a planned invasion by the Allies would have commenced.  What was the code name for this planned invasion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Downfall

questions.question: Who was the US Naval Commander in charge at Pearl Harbor, at the time of the attack?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Husband Kimmel

questions.question: What was the first attack in the Pacific Campaign, launched by the US forces on an island occupied by the Japanese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Battle of Guadalcanal

questions.question: Battle of the Aleutian Islands or The Forgotten Battle was fought from June 6th, 1942 to August 15th, 1943. This battle was part of the Pacific Campaign and it was the last that was fought till the end of the WWII on which countrys land?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the USA

questions.question: How many nations altogether fought on the side of the Allies in the Battle of Normandy that took place on June 6th, 1944?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

questions.question: A college library is sinking into the ground because its architect failed to take the weight of the books into account.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: While the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor was extremely successful, it could have been much worse.  Which of these statements is not a reason why?

options.text: The Oil Tank farms and Machine shops were left undamaged
The Submarine Base was never hit
All 3 US Pacific Fleet aircraft carriers were not in port and were undamaged
Half of the U.S. Battleships were on maneuvers in Alaska at the time of the attack

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Half of the U.S. Battleships were on maneuvers in Alaska at the time of the attack

questions.question: Nike denied a customers request to have his running shoes personalized with the word sweatshop .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Neiman-Marcus charged a shopper $250 for its cookie recipe, instead of $2.50.  As revenge for refusing to reverse the charge, she now provides the recipe for free and asks others to pass it along.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: While it can be argued, most historians agree that this major naval conflict was the turning point in the war in the Pacific for the Allied Forces.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Midway

questions.question: What was the name of the offensive strategy that the allied forces used in the Pacific, against the Japanese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Island Hopping
